intro: Acronia bivalvis, commonly known as the two-valved acronia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive two-part seed capsule. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often producing a soft pink or white hue. Acronia bivalvis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various insects and small animals.
